p: In countries in southern Latin America such as Argentina and Uruguay, outbreaks of HRSV occur predominantly during the winter months [ 22, 61]. In tropical and subtropical climates , the outbreaks are not always well defined, although in Ceara, located in the northeast of Brazil, HRSV caused yearly seasonal epidemics, generally from February until July (Moura et al. 2013). In Brazil, in the cities of Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo, HRSV outbreaks start in autumn (ranging from March to April) and extend until winter (July–August), with peak incidence occurring usually in May (Table 12.1) [ 85, 105].
